name: Ogbaukwu Caves and Waterfall
address: Owerre-Ezukala, Orumba South L.G.A, Anambra State.
cost: N200–N500 per person (affordable entry; group rates lower)
description: West Africa's largest cave, with roomy chambers that could fit a village and a stunning waterfall nearby.

name: Igbo-Ukwu Museum
address: Km 4, Umudege Ezinifite Road, Igbo-Ukwu, Aguata LGA, Anambra State.
cost: N200–N500 per adult (nominal fee for entry and guided tour)
description: Home to 9th-century bronze artifacts showcasing ancient Igbo craftsmanship.

name: Rojenny Tourist Village
address: Km 11, Onitsha-Owerri Expressway, Oba, Idemili South LGA, Anambra State.
cost: N500–N1,000 entry (varies by activity; zoo/swimming extra ~N500)
description: A family-friendly haven in Oba with a zoo, amusement park, swimming pool, and picnic areas.

name: Zik's Mausoleum
address: Bremeo Junction, Limca Road, Isiafor Layout, Onitsha South LGA, Anambra State
cost: Free or nominal N200 (open to public; events may have fees)
description: The resting place of Nigeria's first president, Nnamdi Azikiwe, in Anambra's commercial hub.

name: Agulu Lake
address: Umuowele Village, Agulu, Anaocha LGA, Anambra State.
description: A massive natural lake teeming with crocodiles and birds, offering boat rides and fishing.

name: Igbariam Wonder Lake
address: Igbariam, Anambra East LGA, Anambra State
cost: Free or minimal N100–N200 (local access; boating extra)
description: A scenic lake with sandy beaches and boating opportunities.

name: Anambra Resort (Oba Golf and Country Club)
address: Oba, Idemili South LGA, Anambra State.
cost: N1,000–N5,000 (golf green fees ~N3,000; day pass for facilities)
description: A luxurious spot for golfing, swimming, and spa treatments amid green fairways.

name: Umuoji Area Park
address: Nkwo, Umuodzhi, Idemili North LGA, Anambra State.
description: A lush urban park for picnics, walks, and cultural events.
